snippet: Financial innovations — from small-business loans to limited liability for investors — have long delivered much good to society. A concept in the new jobs law offers yet another example.
abstract: Robert J Shiller Economic View column on crowdfunding, which involves Web sites where investors contribute small amounts of capital to designers of projects soliciting funding online; says benefits may not be immediately apparent, but notes that financial innovations have historically delivered much good to society in a variety of ways.
lead_paragraph: Financial innovations — from small-business loans to limited liability for investors — have long delivered much good to society. A concept in the new jobs law offers yet another example.

headline.print_headline: Democratize Wall Street, For Social Good
headline.seo: Democratize Wall Street, for Social Good
headline.main: Democratize Wall Street, for Social Good
